channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023110976
item.description:
Report X-2023110976

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking inside of a trailer. 2 IC packages listed above were sitting with one end in the puddle. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one bottle appeared dented and felt nearly empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was removed from trailer and placed in salvage drum. Neutralizer was used.

item.title: Report X-2023110972
item.description:
Report X-2023110972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet at the end of the conveyor belt on load side of hub. Leakage was not spreading. DescribePack: Both plastic containers inside of the box were still mostly full but there was spilled green liquid the same color as the liquid in the bottles present. During inspection, one cap fell off causing additional leakage, revealing that it was loose. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a Hazmat bag and moved to Hazmat cage for inspection. When additional leakage occurred, box was immediately placed into a salvage drum. No spillage on the floor occured.

DescribePack: Bottle has a small puncture/crack no larger than a dime, leaking liquid contents everywhere. item.title: Report E-2023110617
item.description:
Report E-2023110617

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, at 1950 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Grand Prairie, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of NOX-RUST® 7703-W (UN1268 PETROLEUM DISTILLATES, N.O.S., (Naphtha Solvent), Combustible liquid, PG III) from (1) 55-gallon DM. It was reported the release was contained to an area of concrete only. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors were informed that facility personnel cleaned the spill and overpacked the damaged container. All waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110595
item.description:
Report E-2023110595

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-28
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote was punctured by an unknown source likely due to inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately 12-gallons of (UN1268) Rikeizai SBS-A26 released onto the wooden trailer floor and the asphalt beneath the trailer. A Contractor responded to perform a tote transfer as well as cleanup the release. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2023110325
item.description:
Report E-2023110325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 15, 2023 at 2041 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (5) gallons of Inferno (UN1824, Sodium Hydroxide, 8, II) from (1) plastic- IBC tote that cracked due to a load shift releasing product onto the trailer floor. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The remaining product in the damaged tote was then transferred into a new plastic IBC tote without complication. All waste generated from addressing the release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110305
item.description:
Report E-2023110305

  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: (1) 5-G pail of Acetone was forked while the pallet was staged on the dock causing a release of (5) G to the dock. The material is evaporated. The pail was placed into an overpack. No drains, waterways affected.

item.title: Report X-2023110403
item.description:
Report X-2023110403

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INFORMED BY SUPERVISOR OF A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE ON DOOR#2 UNLOAD SLIDE. RESPONDER DONNED REQUIRED PPE, FOUND BOX LEAKING PAINT FROM BOTTOM OF BOX AND BOX WET/STAINED ON ONE SIDE. USED DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE ON UNLOAD SLIDE AND FLOOR AREA AROUND SLIDE. TRANSPORTED DAMAGE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ABSORBED MATERIAL TO DMP PROCESSIN AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110238
item.description:
Report E-2023110238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 07, 2023, at 1135 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (1) cup of UN1866 Resin Solution, Flammable, 3, III from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a small area on the side of the drum only. Contractors inspected the trailer and confirmed there was no evidence of a release onto the trailer floor but found 2 additional damaged drums that were not leaking. The impacted drum was wiped clean, and the 3 damaged drums were transferred into a metal overpack without complication. The overpacks and the rest of the cargo were secured for transport and forwarded on to the original consignee. Contractors did not collect any waste during this ER response.

item.title: Report X-2023110346
item.description:
Report X-2023110346

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED TO REVEAL EACH PACKAGE CONTAINED 125 BLUETOOTH PRESSURE SENSORS. EACH SENSOR HAS ONE LITHIUM METAL BATTERY COIN CELL PER SENSOR PACKAGED IN ZIPLOCK TYPE BAGS ALONG WITH BATTERY SPACERS. THE COIN CELL BATTERIES ARE PACKAGED SEPARATE FROM THE DEVICES. THE ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1ZX218440295178515. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES.

item.description:

  • City: HUTCHINS

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package was bagged and placed inside tote box. The original box is deteriorated and come apart. Parts of the decal on the package is non legible. All four bottles are dented and crushed, one bottle is leaking liquid from spout opening and in some places on the body of bottle. DescribePack: There is no package failure, the package was handled or loaded/unloaded improperly. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was double bagged and placed inside a tote box waiting to be taken to hazmat for proper process.

DescribePack: There is slight leakage around the rim of the pail and can be seen on the inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package placed in bin and taken to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023110506
item.description:
Report X-2023110506

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023110506 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING AT THE END OF THE CONVEYOR BELT ON LOAD SIDE, THEN MOVED TO HAZMAT PROCESSING AREA. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, ALL 4 BOTTLES WERE WET. ONE WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING FROM THE CAP WHEN TURNED UPSIDE DOWN. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN DRUM AND MOVED TO HAZMAT AREA. 2. X-2023110508 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND BY AN UNLOAD DOOR WET. BOX WAS PLACED IN A DRUM AND MOVED TO HAZMAT AREA. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION, ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES WAS LEAKING FROM ITS CAP WHEN TURNED UPSIDE DOWN. ALL WERE WET FROM THE LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED IN A DRUM. LEAKAGE WAS NOT SPREADING WHEN FOUND.

item.title: Report X-2023110497
item.description:
Report X-2023110497

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver brought back a damaged package, it appeared to be wet, did not say what happened. I put on my large green safety gloves before inspecting the package. When opened for inspection the item inside of the package had a loose cap which caused the leak. I tightened the cap then placed the gallon and the box inside a blue hazardous materials bag then placed it in a yellow salvage drum awaiting dispostion. DescribePack: The cap was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The gallon had lost majority of the liquid so I tightened the cap.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Shipment 125-59617902 was tendered to British Airways in our Dallas Fort Worth cargo acceptance office located at 2370 WEST AIRFIELD DR STE 100 DFW AIRPORT TX 75261. Upon inspection, a number of packages contained Lithium Batteries contained in equipment that had not been declared on the shipping papers. The shipment is being held awaiting inspection if the FAA wishes to inspect. This was the second shipment with undeclared dangerous goods in two days.

  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TGBU 301802 was found leaking in the Haslet, TX yard. Upon inspection the leak was coming from the container due to 5 gallon pails that tipped during transit. A BNSF Contractor responded, found five 5 gallon pails had leaked from the lid due to the shift of the shipment. The BNSF contractor recovered the released material and secured the container for further shipment.

item.title: Report I-2023110068
item.description:
Report I-2023110068

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: DFW AIRPORT
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This passenger seated on 32H came to the back galley during the second break and told us one of his 3-4 batteries of his vape pen was hot and the wrapper around the battery is half way burnt. They were four flight attendants(#6.#8.#9) in the back galley including myself(#3) and we all smelled the burning odor. We took the battery from the passenger and pulled up standard procedures from manual, retrieved the fire containment bag from compartment 768, flowed the steps and sealed the bag and put it in a empty cart in compartment 972. Upon landing the bag was handed to the passenger and he gave it to people who met the flight. Captain was notified right away and everyone has been monitoring the situation. Management was meeting the flight.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Acetone Tech Grade (UN1090) was released from (1) 1-gallon plastic jug (also contaminated second jug in box) due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 5-gallon DM contains cardboard with (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs with product was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110920
item.description:
Report X-2023110920

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: PFLUGERVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package came to QA station at 5:00 AM in a hazardous materials damage tote. on a visual inspection the box was wet and there was fluid collected at the bottom of the hazmat bag. On an inspection of the contents it was found that a container of rapicide part B had leaked around 2.5 liters of its contents into the bottom of the bag. the package was further contained in a drum using latex gloves and absorbent pads. DescribePack: The container of Rapicide part B failed at its cap. The cap was noticeably loose and unfastened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was placed in a special hazardous materials tote lined with a hazmat bag during the initial spill.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 20 ounces of Econet EY (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged pail, and oil-dri was placed into a 30 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. The waste was left for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: Univar Solutions Private Fleet driver was unloading a sulfuric minibulk delivery at our customer. While unloading into the first tank the Univar driver noticed a leak close to the rear internal valve. Driver estimated release of 15 gallons of sulfuric. Employee immediately called to notify his Supervisor. Emergency response contractor CURA was called. No injury or exposure to the driver or any other personnel on site.

item.title: Report E-2023110381
item.description:
Report E-2023110381

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: WEATHERFORD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had loaded diesel into compartments 1,3 and 4, Driver states he put out cones and stuck tanks. Driver started unloading Compartment 4 into tank 5 and Compartment 1 into tank 4. Driver states that tank 5 had 81” in tank prior to dropping and tank 4 had 80”. Compartment 4 Tank 5 drop completed, and the driver drained the hose and disconnected from truck but left the drop hooked up to ground connection. Driver was planning to move the hose and drop gun from compartment 4 tank 5 to compartment 3 tank 7. Driver checked the other hose and notice the well on tank 4 started to fill up. Driver shut down unloading from compartment 1. The manifold system between the tanks caused tank 5 to fill the well along with product to come back out of hose on the ground. Driver tried to cap the end of the hose that was still hooked up to tank 5 drop and was sprayed with diesel. Driver had to drop the rest of compartment 1 into tank 7. All the diesel tanks are Mani folded together.
